content.question: Part A The functions <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 5 open parentheses 4 x minus 2 close parentheses"> <mi>g</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>-</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> </math> <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals inverse sine open parentheses 8 x close parentheses"> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>8</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfenced> </math>. (i) Solve <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math>. (ii) Solve <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals pi over 4"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>.

frqParts.text: Part A The functions <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 5 open parentheses 4 x minus 2 close parentheses"> <mi>g</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msub> <mi>log</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msub> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>-</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> </math> <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals inverse sine open parentheses 8 x close parentheses"> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>-</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mfenced> <mrow> <mn>8</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfenced> </math>. (i) Solve <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math>. (ii) Solve <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals pi over 4"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>.

Part B The functions <math alttext="j"> <mi>j</mi> </math> and <math alttext="k"> <mi>k</mi> </math> are given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>j</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>sec</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>cot</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4AD6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>k</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>16</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>⋅</mo> <msup> <mn>4</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msup> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4741@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (i) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>j</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOAaiaayIW7caGGOaGaamiEaiaacMcaaaa@3C6D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> as an expression involving <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaci4CaiaacMgacaGGUbGaaGjbVlaadIhaaaa@3CFA@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and no other trigonometric functions. (ii) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>k</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaam4AaiaacIcacaWG4bGaaiykaaaa@3ADE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> as an expression of the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mn>4</mn> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math alttext="a"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math alttext="b"> <mi>b</mi> </math> are constants.

Part C The function <math> <semantics> <mi>m</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyBaaaa@388A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>m</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mn>3</mn> </msqrt> <mi>tan</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mi>π</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@471A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find all input values in the domain of <math> <semantics> <mi>m</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyBaaaa@388A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> that yield an output value of <math> <semantics> <mn>1</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyBaaaa@388A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
